parsed.internal_thinking: Bob's first settlement at Node 42 provides a massive supply of Wheat (9, 9) and Ore (5), totaling 12 pips. This is an excellent foundation for city-building and purchasing Development Cards, but the economy currently lacks Wood, Brick, and Sheep. My goal for the second settlement is to secure these missing resources and establish a path for expansion. Node 31 (Wheat 9, Brick 10, Wood 11) is the most strategic choice. It offers 9 pips of production and provides both Wood and Brick. Crucially, Node 31 is adjacent to Node 41, which is where my first road (42-41) ends. By placing my second settlement at Node 31 and my subsequent road at [31, 41], I will immediately connect my two settlements. This gives me a head start on the Longest Road and creates a unified infrastructure. While I still lack Sheep production, the high Wheat and Ore output will allow me to trade effectively or rely on Development Cards until I can expand toward a Sheep hex or a port. Node 31 is legal and provides 1 Wheat, 1 Brick, and 1 Wood immediately upon placement.
parsed.note_to_self: Connected settlements 42 and 31 via Node 41. Now producing Wheat, Ore, Wood, and Brick. Priority: Find a source of Sheep or reach a 2:1 Wheat/Ore port to leverage high production. Watch Alice at Node 20; she'll likely compete for the center.
parsed.say_outloud: I'm going to set up at Node 31. It gives me a good balance of Wood and Brick to complement my Wheat and Ore, and it connects perfectly with the road I've already started. I'm still looking for a source of Sheep, but this should give me a very strong foundation for expansion. Good luck with your final placements, Alice!
